job_title: Computer Vision and AI Specialist, Solar Innovation
job_description:
At AES, we raise the quality of life around the world by changing the way energy works. Everyone makes an impact every day in our small, global teams. Apply here to start an extraordinary career today.

The Computer Vision and AI Specialist will be a founding member of the solar innovation business responsible for redesigning the future of solar. The Computer Vision and AI Specialist will be responsible for develop, maintain, deploy, and optimize machine learning models and computer vision codes integrated with robotics applications on Atlas, a new growth business that accelerates solar deployment. The foundation of this business is Atlas, the AI-enabled solar module installation robot developed by AES with its key industry partners.

A successful candidate is strongly motivated and passionate about solving computer vision and ML problems and pushing the boundaries of what is possible today and will be an entrepreneurial, passionate individual responsible for actively progressing, developing, and executing the vision, roadmap, and product development of solar module installation robotic system. This individual will take on the responsibility of developing and maintaining machine learning pipeline, deploying new models to production, and monitoring their performance collaborating closely with robotics and mechanical engineers to ensure seamless integration of machine learning models and computer vision codes into our applications. As a specialist in the Atlas business, this position will work collaboratively across the Atlas, external industry partners across the value chain, and AES teams, including engineering, business development, construction, finance, supply chain, and strategy. Atlas team members believe that accelerating decarbonization requires bold action, enabling AES to perform as an industry leader today and evolve to meet future needs while advancing the market for the greater good. The Atlas team embodies AES’ thought leadership through agility, creativity, and entrepreneurial spirit.

Major Responsibilities
• Build high-performing and scalable computer vision and CNN (convolutional neural network) models.
• Work on all stages of model development life cycle from defining data requirements, metrics, and labeling needs to deploying final models as part of the product.
• Tunning hyper-parameters to optimize model performance.
• Stay ahead of the latest ML/CV research by reviewing papers and implementing innovative concepts.
• Develop and improve computer vision AI/ML models by finding opportunities to improve training, validation and deployment.
• Enhance our machine learning pipeline and related tools to support development, experimentation, continuous integration, continuous delivery, verification/validation, and monitoring of AI/ML models in the field.
• Investigate and debug issues in machine learning systems and provide timely resolutions.
• Work with engineers (robotics, mechanical, hardware, etc) to define hardware/software architecture and project roadmap.
• Deliver and implement product roadmap, while fostering strategic partnerships for technology development.
• Develop and continuously update the landscape of technologies, trends, collaborators, and customer needs.
• Drive product improvements and development of requirements for the robotic system to enable delivery of near-term and future commitments.
• Identify and track key solar PV modules installation metrics for tier 1 solar tracker vendors.
• Support on the development of Atlas operations plan based on project requirements within the established schedule.
• Work across Atlas and AES leadership teams to build excitement and confidence around Atlas vision and objectives, and secure direct and indirect resources.
• Foster relationships and work collaboratively with AES businesses and platform units in the US, Americas and Eurasia related to the use of this technology in their region.
• Support periodic project updates and reporting to senior managers through preparation of project status and budget reports.
• Up to 25% travel may be required .

Qualifications

Founder’s mentality: Entrepreneurial passion for getting things done and a “make it happen” attitude with an intellectual curiosity to seek new opportunities.

Experience: Bachelor of Science in STEM field (e.g. statistics, mathematics, machine learning, computer science, physics, engineering, etc.) with 5+ years of proven industry experience in developing computer vision algorithms and deep learning models in Python/C++ for production systems. Experience in using deep learning for object detection, classification, and segmentation. MBA or similar continuing education preferred.

Expertise: Deep knowledge of:
• Frameworks like Pytorch: and Tensorflow and other tools such as MLFlow, Tensorboard, Kubeflow, and Docker.
• Coding using Python, C++ and others.
• Point cloud algorithms (e.g., for LiDAR data from upper robot and lower robot).
• Computational geometry (e.g., full-vision-guided panel pick and Atlas 2NT feedback control).
• Sensor fusion and calibration (e.g., LiDAR+camera, camera+camera);
• 6DoF pose estimation (e.g., Perspective-n-point and, eventually, perspective-n-line).
• Advanced computer vision (e.g., multi-baseline stereo algorithms such as semi-global matching or SGM).

Skill and Behavior: Capability to work dynamically and collaboratively across multiple teams in a fast-paced and technical business environment with minimal supervision. Excellent communication skills. Results-oriented, “can-do” attitude, and “get things done” mentality; comfortable with uncertainty and ambiguity; no compromise on attention to quality and details.

Customer empathy: Strong capability to ideate new solutions and understand customer needs, while driving new products and solutions to market.

Technology fluency: Demonstrated ability to understand solar engineering and technology concepts, question assumptions, and make informed product and technology decisions. Technical understanding of automation, robotics, computer vision, machine learning and/or artificial intelligence, are required.

Languages: English required

AES is an Equal Opportunity Employer who is committed to building strength and delivering long-term sustainability through diversity and inclusion. Respecting all backgrounds, differences and perspectives enables us to improve the lives of our people, customers, suppliers, contractors, and the communities in which we live and work. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and/or expression, race, national origin, ethnicity, age, religion, marital status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. E-Verify Notice: AES will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee’s I-9 to confirm work authorization.

The expected salary for this position, at commencement of employment, is between $131,000 and $164,050/Annual; however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements such as annual bonus, in addition to a full range of medical, dental, vision, life, financial, and/or other benefits (including 401(k) eligibility and various paid time off benefits, such as vacation, sick time, and parental leave), dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if a candidate receives an offer of employment. If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.
